department: Art of Africa and the Americas
description: the handle in the form of an attenuated female torso; pendant breasts with the arms swept wupwards and the hands crossed over the bun at the back; geometric motifs on torso of lead-filled incisions; buffalo hair whisk bound about with woven cotton at the join
medium: extremely hard wood, thin stips of lead, woven cotton fibre, buffalo tail
title: Bakongo Flywhisk
